newsitem.title: BULGARIA: SUPPLY OF BULGARIA LEV DEPOSITS TOPS DEMAND.
newsitem.headline: SUPPLY OF BULGARIA LEV DEPOSITS TOPS DEMAND.

text.p: Activity was low on the Bulgarian lev deposit market on Tuesday as supply of funds topped demand but the money rates were steady, dealers said.
"Banks' liquidity is very high and there is almost no demand for lev deposits," said a dealer.
Overnight interbank depo rates were flat from Monday at 3.0-4.0 percent annually. Spot week rates were around 4.5-5.0 percent, also unchanged.
The average annual interbank deposit rate was 4.24 percent on Monday against 4.80 percent on Friday, a central bank official said.
The central bank cut its simple annual main rate to 6.96 percent from 9.76 percent, effective from July 14.
